primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God replaces human-made, vulnerable defenses with His own divine protection (a wall of fire) to preserve His people in a perilous world.

tekstueel_bewijs: I, saith the Lord, will be unto her a wall of fire
God will defend and if necessary destroy
The Lord will make perfect that which concerneth us
a wall of fire round about
the glory in the midst of her
safeguard your going out and your coming in

ontvanger.identificatie: The 'Young Man' / The Church / The Hearer
tekstueel_bewijs: keep you in the hollow of his hand
our loved ones, our people, our nation
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the vulnerable Receiver who must abandon the role of Subject.

helper.identificatie: Angels and the Holy Spirit (implied through 'spiritually motivated')
tekstueel_bewijs: the angel that talked with me
he shall give his angels charge over thee
the living Lord... is with you always
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Primary Subject who also provides the Helpers.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help and indwelling motivation ('spiritually motivated enterprises').

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Invader' / Sin / The Devil / Human Frailty
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but 'the devil' and 'annihilating weapons,' requiring divine intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human attempt to build walls (self-protection) which inevitably fails.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer / Humanity
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is exposed as a failure to necessitate the primary program (God's action).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Divine Promise → Divine Protection → The Vulnerable Believer

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord will be a wall of fire
He shall give his angels charge over thee
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We want to protect our children
We can do little to protect

voorbeelden: we would that people would appreciate
realize that in all of our human relations... we are helpless
we can do little to protect
they instinctively call on their own gift of flight

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the lack of human 'Pouvoir' (power) and the absolute 'Pouvoir' of God. It is a sermon of enablement through divine agency.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from Niet-S1 (Human walls) to Niet-S2 (Helplessness) to S1 (Divine Protection).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God becoming the wall that man cannot build.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the sermon references slavery, national calamity, and the devil.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While it contains ethical exhortations, the 'engine' of the sermon is God's active protection of a helpless subject.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: We can ask the Lord... and we can lean upon it.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the active Subject of protection
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord will make perfect that which concerneth us.
The devil is ever vigilant... Lord, be a wall of fire.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The mother eagle is used as an analogy for God's providence, not a moral hero for us to imitate.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God is the eagle who carries the weak eaglets.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic preservation: God keeps those who cannot keep themselves.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from human walls to divine walls is logically and narratively seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'standing still' and 'doing the best we can with the weapons we have'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God will defend and if necessary destroy... the enemy swiftly rides forth.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'weapons' of the mind and judgment to the believer.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as an external threat (invaders) and internal helplessness.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Subject of the primary narrative program (Protection).

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly high on 'asking' (Vouloir) as a condition.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Increase the 'Already' of God's protection regardless of the 'asking'.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that God is a wall of fire even before we realize we need one.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly portrayed as 'the devil' and 'annihilating weapons'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God protects) clearly precedes and enables Ethics (we use our gifts).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of theocentric preaching that uses human experience to highlight divine necessity.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'eagle' metaphor's pathos; Greimassian analysis shows the eagle is a functional 'Helper' actant for the 'Subject' God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Zechariah's context; semiotics explains how that context functions as a universal grammar of 'Lack' and 'Liquidation of Lack'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'young man' with the measuring line is a 'False Subject' whose program is superseded by God's 'True Program'.

volledige_subject_lijst: God (will be, will defend, will make perfect)
We (want, can do little, ask, lean)
appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Exemplarism' trap by making the eagle an analogy for God rather than a hero for the congregation to emulate.
